yachts.manufacturer: International Laser Class Association (publisher); licensed manufacturers (boat)

additional.sailorWeightRange: Laser Formula of three rigs for one hull has developed into 3 classes (Laser 4.7, Radial and Standard) for different weight ranges of sailors. Provides a low-cost pathway through age and weight growth. Laser 4.7 ideal for lighter weight sailor (as little as 35 kg). Laser Standard better suited to higher sailor weights as wind increases.

_additional.notes: One common hull for all three Laser rigs (4.7, Radial, Standard).

additional.hullConstructionStandard: ISO Standard 12215 1-5 Hull Construction & Scantlings for Category C

specifications.material: E-glass and balsa core sandwich construction
specifications.gelcoatType: white gelcoat finish and VE resin in the outer layer for osmotic blister protection
specifications.structureDetails: Bi-axial and unidirectional glass fabrics used on both sides of the balsa core and combined with local reinforcements in key highly loaded areas including the hull centerline, keel trunk, transom, bow stem, bow sprit housing and hull flanges. Designed with an inward turning hull flange trimmed to match the finished deck edge allowing for a significant overlap at the glued hull/deck joint. Interior hull surfaces in the cabin areas are finished with a brushed on “air-dry” gelcoat finish.

specifications.material: Molded fiberglass shell surrounding internal structure/ballast
specifications.internalStructure: Fabricated 316SS spar and lifting bolt cast into a lead bulb, structure to support the leading edge and kelp cutter installation.
specifications.attachmentMethod: Four wedges through-bolted at the head of the keel assembly to support and position the keel within the boat. Keel lifting eye positioned inline with the keel CG.

inspectionItems: keel safety plate properly secured in place
maintenanceDetails.commonIssues: Damage to keel and hull at keel trunk if non-standard crane is used for lifting.

_additional.caution: USE OF A YACHT CLUB SINGLE-POINT HOIST OR OTHER NON-STANDARD CRANE TO RAISE THE J/70 KEEL MAY CAUSE DAMAGE TO BOTH THE KEEL AND THE HULL AT THE KEEL TRUNK. J/70 keel lifting eye should only be used with the standard aluminum J/70 keel crane that is designed with a stop to prevent over-hoisting the keel bulb and kelp cutter into the bottom of the hull. Do not attempt to combine the boat lift padeyes with the keel lifting eye during hoist operations.

specifications.material: E-glass and Core-cell foam sandwich construction
specifications.coreType: Core-cell foam (Hi density Airex Pxc core blocking in areas of deck hardware penetrations)
specifications.structureDetails: Additional E-glass reinforcements are specified for areas of deck hardware, mast step, rudder hardware, jib furler, keel recess, toerails, as well as edges and corners as necessary. The deck is bonded to the hull flange with Plexus MA 550. Interior deck surfaces in the cabin areas are finished with a brushed on “air-dry” gelcoat finish.

Do not modify shore connections; use compatible circuit connectors.

specifications.attachmentMethod: 6 screws on each side of centre console

_additional.rollingMethod: Roll from 2nd Batten (fold head in first)

specifications.tensioning: Turn key clockwise until cloth just tight. Over-tightening causes tacking trouble in light weather. Insufficient tension causes flat sail with wrinkles.

inspectionItems: Wear and tear, especially around batten pockets
maintenanceDetails.method: Wash salt off sails after use and dry. Roll from the head (fold head in first). Store sail in its bag in dry conditions away from sunlight. Slightly slacken the top 2 battens’ tension for long term storage. Avoid extreme conditions when using a new sail for the first time. For stains, use light detergent and warm water. DO NOT launder. Temporarily repair with self-adhesive cloth tape (Dacron or Mylar). Return to sail maker for professional repair.
maintenanceDetails.commonIssues: Over-tightened battens cause trouble tacking in light weather. Insufficient tension causes sail to set up too flat with wrinkles.

specifications.attachmentMethod: Pushed into boat, passes underneath webbing strap, tack line fed through first
Clevis pin and split pin to mast

specifications.components: 45mm block, 40mm block, 30mm block, double block, single block with becket, vang purchase line (black), vang rope (pink)
40mm blocks (on boom and hoop), ratchet blocks, whipping twine
40mm block with fiddle/swivel/fixed cam (bottom), cunningham tail, 30mm block with becket (top), cunningham control line
specifications.attachmentMethod: Bottom block shackled to middle metal eye on port side of mast step. Control line tied to block with becket. Tail looped onto top block. Downhaul tail passes through cringle on sail tack and tied to gooseneck fitting.
Slots into keyhole on bow fitting, secured with rubber tapered bung and line
Knot #3 either side of the cringle at the mid point of the sheet to hold the clew in place.

specifications.components: Spinnaker Bag Tube L=650, Spinnaker Bag Tube L=830
Motor, Communication Cables, Communication Module, Battery, Throttle, Screen, Kill switch

installationKillSwitch.description: Three holes need to be drilled in the console, ensuring the location pin is in the centre of the 20mm sensor. A small amount of sealant should be used to fix the sensor in place. Two No.5 x 16 pozi countersunk head screws are used to fix the kill switch to the underside of the console. Test the height of the locator pin using the motor head, adjust so there is a small gap between the pin and the sensor.

installationThrottle.description: Ensure proposed location reserves enough room for operating and will allow rotating the throttle without hitting obstructions (approximately 85mm above deck). Drill holes in the console through the fixing guide. Fix the throttle to the side of the console using the 4 No.6 x 16 self tapping screws provided. Connect 3 cables: thinner cable from motor, kill switch cable, communication cable to display panel (ensure correct port connection).

installationScreen.description: Fix the display panel in the top of the console. Drill hole in the recess following the fixing guide. Attach the communication cable from the back of the throttle to the display. Fix the display panel using 4x No4 x 3/4” Pan Head self tapping screws. Do not over tighten the screws.

specifications.motorCableRouting: Pass motor cable up through console hole using a rope. Power cable (larger) routed through deck gland in front of console. Motor lifting line added and cleated off.

maintenanceDetails.routineMaintenance: Painting, filling of minor scratches, polishing permitted without re-measurement and re-certification. Hull lines and curves shall not be altered.
maintenanceDetails.pvcFilm: May be attached to any part of the hull above the waterlines, provided their fixing gives no performance advantage.
maintenanceDetails.alterations: Hull shell, deck, bulkheads shall not be altered in any way except as permitted. Holes for fittings and lines permitted, but coring, cutting, and material removal for changing inertia is not permitted.

specifications.material: encapsulated in fibre glass and epoxy (as supplied by builder)

maintenanceDetails.fairingAndPainting: Permitted, low density fairing compounds shall be used.
maintenanceDetails.alterations: Shall comply within maximum templates with a tolerance of 0 to 4 mm. Encapsulation shall not be removed. Transverse width from trailing edge to 15 mm forward of trailing edge is free.

maintenanceDetails.fairingAndPainting: Permitted, low density fairing compounds shall be used.
maintenanceDetails.alterations: Shall comply within maximum templates with a tolerance of 0 to 4 mm. Rudder laminate shall not be altered. Transverse width from trailing edge to 15 mm forward of trailing edge is free.

specifications.replacementPolicy: Only by equipment as specified in appendix H1 and H2 or by equipment that in weight is no lighter than equipment defined in appendix H1 and H2.

specifications.restrictions: No restrictions on portable equipment carried except where defined elsewhere within these rules.
specifications.trimmingAndBallastingRestriction: Optional items (C.5.B) or amount of fuel/water in tanks shall not be used for re-trimming, ballasting or alternating fore and aft trim for improving performance for a specific wind range during a series.

additional.tankUsageRestriction: Amount of fuel and water in the tanks shall not be used for re-trimming, ballasting or alternating fore and aft trim of the yacht for the sole purpose of improving the yachts performance for a specific wind range during a series.

specifications.status: Mandatory: One main anchor of not less than 10 kg in weight positioned according to drawing appendix H9 and one anchor warp of minimum length 30 m, positioned according to appendix H9. Anchor and warp not to be moved during racing unless for the purpose of anchoring. Minimum weight of anchor and warp 18,5 kg.

additional.rigChoices: Standard alloy mast or optional carbon mast and boom

specifications.material: Vacuum-infused epoxy with local carbon reinforcement, sandwich construction (glassfibre outer, M-foam core, glass epoxy inner skin)
specifications.color: Standard: Crisp white with pastel blue stripes; Options: White with light grey, white with black grey, pastel blue with white, light grey with white, black grey with white
specifications.thickness: Increased by core layer in sandwich construction

specifications.material: Cast iron fin with lead 'T' bulb, encapsulated in vacuum-infused GRP layer, carbon fibre in keel floors
specifications.attachmentMethod: Integral part of the keel grillage structure, hull liner bonded securely to hull surface

_additional.construction: Precision-moulded, mirror-smooth finish, post-cured GRP skin
_additional.weightSavingByCarbon: Around 400 kgs compared to steel system

specifications.material: High quality alloy stocks (for slim profile)

_additional.design: Custom fit for hull shape, underwater profile and sail plan, designed in-house using VPPs

specifications.finish: Teak decking (standard), option to extend to side decks and coach roof
specifications.fittings: Concealed passages for halyards/sheets/trim lines, flush fittings, folding Nomen mooring cleats

_additional.bulwarkDesign: Width varies for comfort of 'hiking' crew
_additional.ergonomics: Carefully considered for cruising and racing

specifications.features: Centre console (foot chock), adjustable foot-chocks, cockpit lockers, built-in halyard bin, designated recess for sprayhood framework and canvas, 'garage' for washboard
specifications.transom: Optional folding transom creates secure stern area or teak-topped swim platform with telescopic swim ladder

_additional.usage: Can be carried with spinnaker pole (optional)

_additional.lineManagement: Halyards and trim lines led aft concealed below deck
Mainsheet led along boom to gooseneck, down to deck-recessed blocks, then below side decks

specifications.components: Series connected steering cables, large quadrant

_additional.responsiveness: Optimum, reduced moments of inertia compared to metal wheels
_additional.autopilotConnection: Optional autopilot ram connects to quadrant

variations: Standard GRP cowl with integrated anchor fitting
Optional white painted carbon bowsprit with integrated anchor fitting
Optional clearcoat black carbon bowsprit with integrated anchor fitting
Optional plain GRP cowl (for ORC racing)

_additional.anchorFitting: Neatly concealed under sprit for carbon options
_additional.sailWardrobe: Enables asymmetric spinnakers and reaching Code Zeros

_additional.weightSaving: Designed as part of internal building blocks, saving weight on duplicated structures

options: Optional large instrument mount with grab-rail
Optional small instrument mount with grab-rail

specifications.viewing: Ease of viewing by all members of crew
Ease of viewing by all members of crew

_additional.ramConnection: Optional autopilot ram connects to steering quadrant

_additional.integration: Part of the 18 essential through-hull fittings which are recessed and faired

specifications.location: Separates anchor compartment, sail locker, and interior accommodation
specifications.function: Safety and reassurance in event of collision
